intro: Alyxia cylindrocarpa var. obtusiuscula, commonly known as the blunt-leaf alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves with rounded tips. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent, spurred corona. This variety is distinguished by its broader, more rounded leaves compared to other forms of Alyxia cylindrocarpa.
